meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Get ready for a delightful dive into the world of "Humanity," where creativity and problem-solving come together in a beautiful package. As I wade through the review ocean, I'll give you the lowdown on what makes this game so special.

First off, let's talk about the critics. Oh boy, they're raving about this one! IGN calls it "a beautiful, modern reimagining" that's "esoteric and artsy." GameSpot says it's a "charming, engaging, and inviting puzzle adventure." Game Informer praises its balance of challenge and feel-good vibes. Vandal thinks it's "fantastic," while GamingTrend gushes about its "vast, clever, inventive, and eclectic" design. And COGconnected and God is a Geek both give it an 85, calling it "weird and wonderful" and "expertly crafted," respectively.

Now that we've got the critical consensus out of the way, let's talk gameplay! Humanity is all about using your little human feet to solve puzzles and navigate through increasingly complex levels. It's like Lemmings meets Portal – minus the annoying singing. You'll need to think creatively and use your problem-solving skills to overcome obstacles and reach your goals.

One thing that sets Humanity apart is its focus on creativity and collaboration. You can play with friends, share user-created levels, or even create your own! It's like having your very own puzzle party. And the best part? The game's unique premise and constantly evolving gameplay keep things fresh and exciting throughout.

So, what's not to love about "Humanity"? Well, some critics noted a few minor flaws – like the occasional difficulty spike or the lack of a complete hint system. But overall, these complaints are just minor quibbles in an otherwise fantastic puzzle game.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a puzzle game that will challenge your brain and warm your heart, look no further than "Humanity." With its creative gameplay, beautiful visuals, and emphasis on collaboration, this game is sure to delight puzzle fans of all ages. And who knows? You might just learn something about what it means to be human along the way.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some puzzles to solve... or maybe I'll just play around with those user-created levels and see where the road takes me!
